intro: Nephrodium barometz, commonly known as the storm fern, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the family Nephrodiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, shield-like fronds that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures are unique, featuring specialized spore-producing organs called sorangia. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, Nephrodium barometz is considered endangered in many parts of its native range.
